text: Chaumont is a commune of France, and the capital (or prefecture) of the Haute- Marne department in the Grand Est region. ==Geography== The city of Chaumont is on the Langres plateau on the geographical centre of the Haute-Marne department in northeast France. It is along the Marne (river) river. It has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Distance from Chaumont to other cities Paris Strasbourg Bordeaux Toulouse Montpellier Lyon Nantes Marseille Chaumont and its neighboring communes The commune of Chaumont is surrounded by the communes Condes, Treix, Chamarandes- Choignes, Laville-aux-Bois, Biesles, Verbiesles, Neuilly-sur-Suize, Richebourg, Semoutiers-Montsaon, Villiers-le-Sec and Jonchery. Two rivers flow through the city: the Suize to the west and the Marne to the east. ===Climate=== The climate of Chaumont, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Chaumont are known, in French, as Chaumontais (women: Chaumontaises). The city of Chaumont has a population, in 2014, of 22,674; its population density is of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Chaumont, formed by 65 communes, with a population of 42,594 inhabitants (2014) and an area of . == Administration == Chaumont is the prefecture of the Haute-Marne department, the capital of the arrondissement of Chaumont and the administrative centre () of three cantons: * Chaumont-1 formed by 6 communes and part of Chaumont, with 10,816 inhabitants (2014). * Chaumont-2 formed by 4 communes and part of Chaumont, with 8,534 inhabitants (2014). * Chaumont-3 formed by 5 communes and part of Chaumont, with 10,609 inhabitants (2014). It is part of the intercommunality Chaumont, du Bassin Nogentais et du Bassin de Bologne Vignory Froncles (). === Twinned and partner towns === Chaumont is twinned with: * Ashton-under-Lyne, England, since 1956. * Ivrée, Italy, since 1983. * Bad Nauheim, Germany, since 1992. * Oostkamp, Belgium, since 2004. ==Gallery== File:Chaumont (Haute- Marne) vieille ville.jpg|Chaumont old city File:Le viaduc de Chaumont 1856.jpg|The viaduct of Chaumont File:France Haute Marne Chaumont 02.jpg| Saint Jean Baptiste Basilica File:Basilique St jean Baptiste de Chaumont (52).jpg|Saint Jean Baptiste Basilica inside ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Chaumont * Communes of the Haute-Marne department ==References== ==Other websites== * Site officiel de la ville de Chaumont * Office de Tourisme du Pays de Chaumont en Champagne
